This is an amazing game.  It does horror (not merely asymmetrical, but horror in general) better than anything I've played in the past 5 years.  The killers are intimidating, the survivors (David King is my favorite) are vulnerable and have personality, and the settings are frightening.  

My only complaint is that, if a killer doesn't like the setting an offering might produce, the killer can disconnect.  I know there are bans for excessive disconnection, but in the meantime the survivors still lose their offerings and, occasionally, their items as well.  We work hard to get those things through bloodpoints and taking chances on chests; it's not right that a wussy kliller can cause us to lose them.  The game would be better with some sort of system to see who disconnected and only cost THAT person their items and offerings.  This is not simple development, I know, but it would make the game better and fairer.  (Life may not be fair, but the games we play should try to be so.) NOTE:  This has since been remedied. Nice, Behaviour. :) 

Other than that one piffle, though, this is an exemplary game, and it's constantly evolving.  Been out a year and a half now, and just keeps getting better.  Well done, Behaviour!

Addendum:  This game is still amazing and I still recommend it, for its staying power alone - but the player base grows more toxic by the minute.  My recommendation to Behaviour - remove the post-match chat.  People might grumble, but when the immediacy has faded, people might be more charitable if they don't say the first stupid thing that comes to mind after a match.

Dead by Daylight is one of the best horror multiplayer games out there! Once you learn how to play, you will have loads of fun chasing, or being chased. It does contain features that could be improved, but the best way to resolve all these issues with the game is getting more players and more community feedback. If you enjoy being under pressure, feeling adrenaline and jump scares, this is the game for you! Hope you enjoy your long nights playing it! Highly recomend it!

I posted a review for this game awhile back, probably time for a revision.

=============================COMMUNITY===============================
The community around this game has definitely taken a turn for the better recently, around 2018-2019 a decent majority of the community was INCREDIBLY toxic, but for whatever reason, during 2020, the community has had a huge reform, people are way nicer, and people don't play as toxicly. In it's current state, you'll see a decent amount of toxicity in the brown to yellow ranks, however once you're hovering around the green to purple ranks, things get a lot more chill.
=============================GAMEPLAY================================
The last time I wrote this review, OCHiDO was a pretty big community figure, now, thankfully, he's been banned from the game, and has lost a huge chunk of his fanbase, so not as many glitches, bugs or exploits are being found and abused by his mongoloid fans.

Anyways, aside from that, the gameplay right now is in a decent state, Decisive Strike got balanced in probably the best way it could be, deterring killers from tunneling, which I find amazing. The only perk I have a huge quarrel with at the moment is "No One Escapes Death," (frequently abbreviated as "NOED), this perk is such a huge crutch for killers, and there is pretty much no reason for it to be in the game. This isn't coming from just me, many other players, including killer mains, have huge problems with this perk. (If you're unfamiliar with NOED, it lets killer one-hit down survivors at the end of the game, the only way to avoid this perk is by cleansing any totem it will spawn on, which 8 totems are scattered across each map)
===============================DEV TEAM===============================
Dev team is pretty chill, they're very communicative with the community and are never vague when it comes to changing things around the game. Only problem I have with them is that they aren't really the best listeners sometimes, however that's only on a few select occasions. Can't really complain about much here.
=============================BALANCE=================================
This is the main reason I wanted to re-do this review, because a lot of the takes I made here are WAY outdated, (This review was originally made mid to late 2018, a lot has changed in 2 years, go figure.) Anyways, I've already stated my quarrels with NOED, and there's not really anything to write home about for the balance besides that, except maybe some of the iridescent add-ons for killers, although those are so rare and expensive it's not really worth complaining over. Only thing I would do is make those add-ons a bit harder to get. 
============================OVERALL===================================
Wow, looking back on how I originally wrote the "Overall" section really hit me hard, lots of old takes bashing on Hex: Ruin and Decisive Strike, what a time that was.

Anyways, enough cheesy monologue.

Overall, I'd say Dead by Daylight is a fantastic game, especially if you can get your friends to buy a copy as well. The leveling system is fun to get through, juking killers and outplaying survivors feels so satisfying, and the game receives CONSTANT updates to keep the community happy. This game has definitely come far in the last 2 years since I posted my original review, and I'm happy to see it has. 

Anyways, that's all the time I've got, I need to get back to playing Animal Crossing: New Leaf, on my Nintendo 3DS.
======================================================================

Thank you for reading my poorly re-written in 10 minutes review about a game that has been a big part of my life for the past 2-3 years I've owned it. Anyways, deuces, and see you in the fog.
